column1: #Text=[0154]In Synthetic Pathway J, the compound represented by the following general formula (45):
#Text=[wherein R.sub.1, R.sub.2 and X are as defined above] can be produced by reacting the compound represented by the general formula (44) with MSH (Step J-2).
#Text=[0155]Specifically, the compound represented by the general formula (44) is dissolved in an organic solvent such as THF, DMF, cyclohexane, benzene, toluene or methylene chloride.
#Text=This solution is reacted with a solution of MSH in methylene chloride at 0.degree.
#Text=This is followed by addition of an inorganic base, such as sodium carbonate or potassium carbonate, or MSH.
#Text=Palladium chloride in acetonitrile is then added and the reaction mixture is refluxed to obtain the desired compound.
